TopicTitle: Make a wish... and have it horribly corrupted!

Articles.Content:
Granted. However, you cannot wish two wishes ahead

I wish for more people to use

boo

Granted. However, they do it in tiny text.

I wish that the spoiler tag existed here.

Except you don't know how to use them

I wish for potato

Granted, the potato is cursed, but you get a free frogurt. It is also cursed. But you get your free choice of topping. The toppings are made of potassium benzoate. That's bad.

I want a frogurt.

Granted. It is a living frog made out of yogurt.

I wish for a frog-yogurt to power my hamster wheel generator for all eternity.

granted, but the power output is so small its useless.

I wish I could blow up an asteroid, Bruce Willis style.

You blow up with the asteriod.

i wish my friend will stop farting.

(notice i never said things about others?)

granted, since you did not specify which friend, they all explode from holding it in and their deaths are blamed on you as you were in their vicinity during their demise. you are sent to prison and remain lonely for the rest of your life

i wish i can read faster

You travel at the speed of light, read Atlas Shrugged from start to finish and discover 4000 years have passed back on earth.

I wish I could polka.

Granted. Now you can poke-ah-anyone you want.

I wish i had more time to think of a good wish to post here.

Granted. You used up your only wish.

I wish my chewing gum was 40% toxic lead, 40% tungsten, 40% calories, and %40 pure gold.

Granted everyone measures % now in 80 units instead of 100

I wish I wish I was A FISH!!!

i eat you for dinner

i wish My friend nevan would stop farting on the elevator

granted, now he farts everywhere else

I wish spring break lasted another week.

Granted. However, it doesn't start till may. (Because it does start in may.)

I wish for horse buyers.

Granted, but they mistake you for a horse (OR PONY) and bought you. You became their slave.

I wish I can die.

Granted, but only after 1000 years.

I wish I was a bit better at driving...

Granted, but you are horrible at everything else.

I wish for this to all be a dream and i'm a kerbal, preferably jeb.

Granted. You're so good at driving that you start racing at which you crash and don't drive anymore.

I wish I could shuttle.

Yes, I wish "I could shuttle."

Granted, You shuttle so well that you became the shuttle bus.

I wish for a brick.

Granted. It just happens to be hurtling towards your head at 0.9c.

I wish I could throw a baseball that fast.

Granted, but there's another person with the ability to catch your fastball.

I wish I could be the star in a movie.

Granted. You serve as a star in an astronomy movie by going really really far out and holding a spotlight.

I wish it wasn't so cold.

Granted. Cold? What is cold? Sorry, all we talk about in this plane of reality is lukewarm, warm, hot, boiling, melting, scorching, ignition point, flash point, explosive disassembly, and instant spontaneous combustion.

I have never heard of this "cold" you speak of. Looks like today will be yet another "flash point" day. Take a walk outside your designated zone, and you will catch fire within minutes of exiting the zone. The flames almost seem alive as they dance on the dry plains outside, licking greedily up the sides of once-great structures, now bent and buckled under the long centuries of heat you have cursed this world with. Metals have always been known to conduct heat rather well, but these days it gets so hot that sometimes you think you can see parts of the metal joining the flames in their endless dance through the air.

You were lucky -- you were at home, as usual, when the timelines were rewritten. Others weren't so lucky. Anyone anywhere near a gas appliance, gas-powered automobile, petrol station, hell even people standing too close to once-ordinary batteries were horribly disfigured. Many, many lives were lost that day, though the records invariably say those people had all died long ago, in horrific accidents. The great pyramids that once stood in Egypt and South America all melted to the ground in floes of almost-lava upon the first day of this curse. Although all know that you were responsible for this unimaginable curse, none can truly prove it -- after all, the Internet, and all technology not designed to be heat-proof, has melted away completely already, the metallic and silicone vapours adrift on the breeze since the very first day.

I wish people wouldn't wish without thinking of the consequences.

granted. They think about them. but don't care. so your wish is useless.

i wish i was flying right now (like in a plane not like fantasy flying)
